title: Alesha MacPhail remembered in emotional birthday vigil as mum shares wish
text:

Alesha MacPhail's mum said she wishes she could see her daughter's "beautiful face" as she marked what would have been her eighth birthday.

Georgina Lochrane spoke days before friends and family of the murdered schoolgirl met an an emotional balloon vigil in her hometown of Airdrie in Scotland.

Dozens of people had gathered in a park in the town close to a pink bench erected in her memory on Sunday night, reports the Daily Record .

Those gathered sang songs including Thinking Out Loud by Ed Sheeran .

Grieving mum Georgina, 24, previously told how she will sing Happy Birthday at her grave each year to mark the milestone.

(Image: Jamie Williamson)

She said: "On her birthday we will do as we did last year and go up to Alesha’s grave and just spend as long as we can up there with her.

“Alesha should really should be here to celebrate her birthday, not having a vigil in her memory. But as long as I live on this earth Alesha will never be forgotten and I doubt her sister will let it happen after I’m gone.

“This week all I have done is wish her wee beautiful face would come bouncing into the living room, most probably giving me the last minute changes to her birthday presents or asking is she’s getting a birthday cake.

(Image: Jamie Williamson)

(Image: PA)

“I know it’s only been a year but it honestly feels like forever since I last saw her face, heard her voice and cuddled her.

“I sit and think about how much she would have changed over the year and how grown up she would be now.”

(Image: PA)

Alesha was raped and murdered by monster Aaron Campbell - 16 at the time - after being abducted from bed at her grandparent's home on the Isle of Bute.

He was sentenced to a minimum of 27 years in prison after confessing to the crime, which was later slashed to 24 years.
description: Georgina Lochrane spoke as the murdered schoolgirl's family and friends held a vigil in Airdrie, Scotland, to mark what wold have been her eighth birthday
